His SNL success led to a string of film roles, including Caddyshack (1980), Stripes (1981), and Ghostbusters (1984).

Murray has continued to appear in a wide range of films, from the family-friendly comedy The Jungle Book (2016) to the critically acclaimed drama St. Vincent (2014). Throughout his career, Murray has been recognized for his unique blend of humor, intelligence, and vulnerability. He has been named one of the greatest comedians of all time by Entertainment Weekly and has received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Despite his success, Murray remains humble and private, known for his laid-back demeanor and love of golf.

Murray's early career began with a brief stint as an understudy on Broadway in 1977. He soon found success as a member of the Second City improv group, where he met future collaborators Harold Ramis and Brian Doyle-Murray. In 1978, he joined the cast of Saturday Night Live, quickly becoming a fan favorite with his dry wit and impressions.

After leaving SNL in 1980, Murray co-starred with Harold Ramis in the hit comedy Caddyshack (1980) and went on to appear in several successful films, including Stripes (1981), Ghostbusters (1984), and Groundhog Day (1993). His versatility as a comedic actor led to roles in dramatic films, such as Lost in Translation (2003) and Broken Flowers (2005), both earning him critical acclaim and numerous award nominations.

Throughout his career, Murray has worked with many notable directors, including Wes Anderson, Sofia Coppola, and Jim Jarmusch. His collaborations with the Coen brothers, such as Rushmore (1998) and The Royal Tenenbaums (2001), are particularly notable. Murray's distinctive humor and nuanced performances have made him a beloved figure in the entertainment industry.

Beyond acting, Murray is an avid golfer and has participated in various charity golf tournaments. He has also been involved in various environmental and philanthropic efforts, including the development of the golf course at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics.

Throughout his six-decade-long career, Bill Murray has received numerous awards and accolades, including two Golden Globe Awards, three BAFTA Awards, and an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor for his role in Lost in Translation. He continues to entertain audiences with his unique blend of humor, wit, and poignancy, solidifying his status as one of the most iconic and enduring comedians of our time.
